title: Mark McElroy (Ohio politician)
text:
Mark McElroy (October 16, 1906 – December 14, 1981) was a <a href="United%20States%20Democratic%20Party">Democratic</a> politician from <a href="Cleveland">Cleveland, Ohio</a>, United States. He served in both houses of the <a href="Ohio%20General%20Assembly">Ohio General Assembly</a> and was <a href="Ohio%20Attorney%20General">Ohio Attorney General</a> from 1959 to 1963.
Biography.
McElroy was born in <a href="Cleveland%2C%20Ohio">Cleveland, Ohio</a> in 1906. He attended the city schools, and <a href="Kenyon%20College">Kenyon College</a>, where he won nine letters in <a href="American%20football">football</a>, <a href="baseball">baseball</a> and <a href="basketball">basketball</a>. He was captain and quarterback in 1930 on the Kenyon Lords football team. After graduating, he earned a law degree in 1934 from the <a href="Case%20Western%20Reserve%20University%20School%20of%20Law">Case Western Reserve University School of Law</a>.
Immediately after college, McElroy ran unsuccessfully for the <a href="Ohio%20House%20of%20Representatives">Ohio House of Representatives</a>. He was an active <a href="United%20States%20Democratic%20Party">Democrat</a>, serving as ward leader, precinct committeeman, and member of the county executive committee.
Before his election as <a href="Ohio%20Attorney%20General">Ohio Attorney General</a>, McElroy was a member of the <a href="Ohio%20House%20of%20Representatives">Ohio House of Representatives</a>, <a href="Ohio%20State%20Senate">Ohio State Senate</a>, and Cleveland City Council. He also unsuccessfully challenged <a href="Anthony%20J.%20Celebrezze">Anthony J. Celebrezze</a> for <a href="Mayor%20of%20Cleveland">Mayor of Cleveland</a>.
McElroy was elected Attorney General in 1958 in a Democratic landslide, and served one four-year term.
McElroy was married to Marie Niznol in about 1956.
